structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS

law.catch_line: Power of commission to acquire property -- Methods of acquisition.
law.text: The commission may acquire, by gift, purchase, lease or condemnation, any real or personal property situated wholly within the city or county, or any interest, franchise, easement, right or privilege in the city or county, of any buildings, tools, machinery, materials or supplies that may be required for the purpose of furnishing, maintaining or operating the memorial. The proceedings for condemnation shall be conducted in the name of the commission in the method prescribed by the Eminent Domain Act of Kentucky. All property acquired by the commission shall be held, used and controlled by it for the purposes named in KRS 97.630 to 97.780.
law.history: Amended 1976 Ky. Acts ch. 140, sec. 51. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. secs. 3037i-1, 3037i-6.
